Employability and Personal Development

This module provides an in-depth exploration of personal and professional development. It focuses on self-discovery, strategic career planning, and ethical professionalism, key to the hospitality industry. Students engage in selfassessment, goal-setting, and reflective practices, learning to leverage personal strengths and weaknesses for career success. The module will also cover CV and cover letter writing in preparation for the upcoming internship. The course also covers effective networking and personal branding, vital for industry presence. Emphasizing ethical decision-making and professionalism, the module equips students to adeptly navigate the hospitality sector. It culminates in a portfolio reflecting each student's growth and industry readiness.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Develop an in-depth understanding of self, including personal strengths, weaknesses, and career aspirations.

+  Formulate strategies for continuous personal growth and adaptability in the hospitality industry.

+  Master the art of setting and pursuing clear, strategic career goals in hospitality management, encompassing skills development, networking, and personal branding.

+  Cultivate the ability to critically reflect on experiences and decisions, emphasizing ethical considerations and professionalism in hospitality settings.
